data.title: Eclipse Import: Timeout of 120000 reached waiting for exclussive access to file 'gradle-2.4-all.zip'.
data.body:
I just get the error `Eclipse Import: Timeout of 120000 reached waiting for exclussive access to file 'gradle-2.4-all.zip'.` when I try to import my freshly generated libgdx project in Eclipse Mars.

![gradle_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6271057/12036817/bd92cc72-ae49-11e5-90c1-dc5f7defd3d1.jpg)

`Gradle IDE 3.7.3.201512211912-CI-B53` is currently installed.

I'm unsure where to find the mentioned erorr log. I don't see one in my project directory.

Thanks for looking at this!

data.title: Proper capitalisation in project generator
data.body: Fixes #3641

data.title: Image's draw method sets the batch color to its color and never changes it back.
data.body:
Image sets the batch's color in the draw method and never sets it back. This means that if you alter an Image's color or alpha, once that image is drawn all the following Actors will be drawn with the same color. I can't imagine this is intended since it is unintuitive and not useful in any way that I can imagine.

To work around it, one can extend Image and override the draw method to reset the batch color.

data.title: Space bar keypress is not detected when you have left arrow and top arrow pressed.
data.body:
Ok this is kind of specific, but here to reproduce.

1) Use libgdx 1.7.2 (I tried 1.7.3-snapshot and 1.6.2, both have the same issue).
2) Run gdx input test program
3) Press LEFT (code: 21) and TOP (code: 19) then also press SPACE BAR (62), the SPACE BAR don't get reported in the InputProcessor keyDown function.

data.title: remove unused boneId variable in ModelNode data class
data.body:
I might miss its purpose but this variable is not used at all. 

The same goes for ModelNode.meshId, but I didn't remove it since it is written to (but never read from). Can do another commit if needed.

This is quite a non-important change so feel free to reject it but I thought it would help reduce the complexity of libgdx's node architecture. I'm writing my own model loader right now and the amount of variables in the data classes is a bit overwhelming, and if some of them are not used, it's even more confusing.

data.title: Finish LWJGL 3 backend and request for testing
data.body:
## LWJGL 3 backend

I just committed the first iteration of the new LWJGL 3 backend. Going forward, i hope this can largely replace the old LWJGL 2 backend, especially on Mac OS X where we have a lot of problems with LWJGL 2. The new backend is also prepared for multi-window environments, altough respective methods in `Lwjgl3Application` haven't been exposed yet.

The LWJGL 3 backend is structure the same way as the LWJGL 2 backend, including the main module in `backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl3` and a test module in `tests/gdx-tests-lwjgl3`. Everything is wired up with Maven and Eclipse projects so you can test things. I also wired it up with our Ant build, haven't tested that one at all.

It would be amazing if you guys could help test this. I already build snapshots for the new backend, and all the code is merged with master. You can easily switch out the LWJGL 2 backend for the LWJGL 3 backend in Gradle. In your `core` projects dependencies, change:

```
compile "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-backend-lwjgl:$gdxVersion"
```

to

```
compile "com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-backend-lwjgl3:$gdxVersion"
```

Make sure `gdxVersion` is set to the latest snapshot version `1.7.3-SNAPSHOT`. In your desktop launcher, simply replace `LwjglApplicationConfiguration` and `LwjglApplication` with `Lwjgl3ApplicationConfiguration` and `Lwjgl3Application`. That's it.
### Not implemented yet
- [ ] Window refresh callback for nicer resize
- [x] HDPI support. Works out of the box on mac os x, but need to scale mouse coords accordingly. They are reported in logical coords, whereas `Graphics` reports framebuffer size now.
- [x] Screen mode change related functions in [Lwjgl3Graphics](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl3/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl3/Lwjgl3Graphics.java#L163). Just haven't gotten around implementing those. Note that when changing the screen mode (e.g. window -> fullscreen), GLFW returns a new window handle. `Lwjgl3Input` and `Lwjgl3Graphics` need to re-register all the GLFW callbacks in that case with the new window handle.
- [x] Clipboard support without AWT on Mac OS X
- [x] Fix fullscreen toggling. On Mac OS X, the first windowed -> fullscreen switch fails in weird ways, e.g. clearColor has an effect, but rendering doesn't. Subsequent fullscreen -> fullscreen switches work as intended (but those use `glfwSetWindowSize` instead of creating a new window). On Window (10) fullscreen switching doesn't work at all on HDPI monitors, need to test on normal monitors. [Bug for Windows](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/676), [Bug for Mac OS X](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/680). Should be resolved in GLFW, libGDX side does the proper thing.
- [x] Custom cursors in `Lwjgl3Graphics`. Haven't checked how to do that yet.
- [x] Application icon support. This needs to be covered via tools like [PackR](https://github.com/libgdx/packr)
- [x] Platform-specific multi-window API (`Lwjgl3Application#newWindow(ApplicationListener, int width, int height)/newWindow(ApplicationListener, DisplayMode)`).
- [x] Controller support. GLFW comes with its own controller API, should be simply to add that to the controllers extension. There's a [bug](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/601) on Windows in GLFW, where all gamepads are reported by the same name. This makes mapping controller types impossible.
- [x] OpenGL 3.0 support. We should only need to add that to `Lwjgl3Application#createGlfwWindow`. The `Lwjgl3GL30` implementation is prepared, except for `Lwjgl3GL30#glGetBufferPointerv`
- [ ] Mac OS X (potentially Windows and Linux too): glfwSwapBuffers doesn't block in windowed mode if app window is fully behind other window or minimized. [Bug](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/680) with GLFW. Could "fix" it in our own code.
- [ ] [Lwjgl3Input#getTextInput()](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl3/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl3/Lwjgl3Input.java#L240), can't call into Swing/AWT
- [x] Non-continuous rendering in `Lwjgl3Graphics`. It's a bit of a bitch. `Lwjgl3Input` will already call `Graphics#requestRendering()` in case new input events arrive
- [ ] Make OpenALAudio thread-safe, put the update on a separate thread
### Known Issues
- LWJGL 3 is based on GLFW. GLFW and AWT don't play nice with each other. Calling Swing/AWT stuff is thus not possible at the moment.
- On Mac OS X, you need to pass the JVM argument `-XstartOnFirstThread` when starting your app. We may be able to fix both things to some extend.
- If you use the multi-window API, understand that any `Runnable` you post via `Gdx.app.postRunnable()` may be executed in such a way that the statics in `Gdx`, like `Gdx.graphics` may point to a window other than the one for which the runnable was posted.

data.title: Json readValue should not discard typeName
ShapeRenderer wrong behavior with Line/Filled
Spelling fixes and cleanup in SuperKoalio test
data.body: These are some minor edits I made when experimenting with the SuperKoalio file. They do not change any functionality, but I figured I might as well propose them for the master.

data.title: Added missing license
Game Controller Wrappers
data.body:
Hi, this is more of just a discussion point, but basically every time I integrate controllers into games I end up doing something similar to what I do in this post: http://kennycason.com/posts/2015-12-27-libgdx-controller.html

That is, 1) create an easier to use controller interface, 2) support input from multiple controllers at once (imagine seamless keyboard + controller support) (optional), 3) basic timestamps for keypresses 4) support key combos (not in demo posted)

Is this sort of wrapper useful for people over all? Or is this too specific to my use-cases? Just figured it would be worth bringing up. 

Feel free to close the issue at any time :)

data.title: Png file is not created together with fnt file
data.body: Going to Menu File>Save BMFont files (text) only creates the fnt file. The png is missing

data.title: Support for GL_TEXTURE_EXTERNAL_OES
data.body:
I'm trying to create Texture that is GL_TEXTURE_EXTERNAL_OES to share the texture through multiple threads (i.e. Android & LibGDX) , the problem that I have with this that the OO structure of Texture & GLTexture classes make it impossible to use any thing other than the hardcoded GL_TEXTURE_2D as the Texture class is hiding the most important constructor of the GLTexture (public GLTexture (int glTarget, int glHandle)) , not sure why !

Any alternative way for this ? I can create this texture in Android, but not sure how to convert it to LibGDX Texture after that to pass it around to UIs 

Thanks

data.title: Add pixmap.getPixels() method, clean tests
data.body:
The canvas (used for storing the pixmap) has an CanvasPixelArray, which
basically is an UInt8ClampedArray.
So getPixels() returns a ByteBuffer. This ByteBuffer is an 
DirectByteBuffer, which wraps the ArrayBuffer of the UInt8ClampedArray.

data.title: Fix bug, now also works with RGBA8888
Gwt local files with LocalStorage API
data.body: There seems to be a class that emulates a file system using local storage API in the gwt backend, but GwtFileHandle and GwtFiles throw exceptions for everything of FileType.local. Does anyone know why the default implementations of these classes is not used and let the emulating class (java.io.File) take over?

data.title: defaultConfig.applicationId in android/build.gradle
data.body:
Hello guys,

Please, add the defaultConfig.applicationId with a package name to android/build.gradle, inside the Setup App.

I've encountered a weird issue - my app couldn't be installed on some new Samsung devices, like Note 5 and Galaxy S6, if they had some other app installed with the same problem (see below). People received the -505 error code during the installation of my app.

The explanation that helped me is here:
https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=193567

Yes, and this issue appeared after I updated Google Analytics.

data.title: GWT/html5 build - dangling entries in the joint list of a box2d world
Clearing pixmap doesn't work on HTML5
data.body:
It's supposed be done like this:

``` java
Pixmap.setColor(Color.CLEAR);
Pixmap.fill();
```

It works on desktop but not on HTML5.
Filling with any other color works, but clearing the pixmap to be all transparent again doesn't work on HTML5.
Is this a bug or setting a different blendmode could work?

Stage Constructor Allowing Root Group to be Supplied
Need help with bullet iterator in a top down shooter
Scaling Action on Scene2d Window affects stageBackground dim
Removing unwanted jars
data.body:
Hey everyone,

So my android app excedeed the number of total methods permited (65K) so it can't build into a dex file. Basically, when i first created the libgdx project i included some extensions that were available (AI, box2d, bullet, lights ) and now i see i don't need anything of those jars in my project. How can i remove these jars so i can make my app more lightweight?. I'm also trying to use proguard to reduce the number of packages used in google play services.

Best Regards

data.title: Fixed HexagonalTiledMapRenderer drawing order, added stagger axis and
data.body:
index support

The current implementation draws top to bottom, which is an issue for 2.5D tiles. It also does not respect that for stagger axis X depending on the stagger index either all even tiles have to be rendered after the odd tiles or vice versa.

data.title: Exception while parsing JSON arrays in 1.7.2.
data.body:
Queue class should be added to reflection cache.
According to his commit https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/397de2c5ac686447c23d1d4a76ebbdf3587e5d5a GWT backend cant parse json arrays. Adding Queue.java to https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backends-gwt/src/com/badlogic/gwtref/GwtReflect.gwt.xml fix that problem.

data.title: [FreeType] SIGSEGV when using incremental + Korean text
Added ability to set position with Vector2
data.body: Added ability to set position of `scene2d.Actor` by using a Vector2. This just means it is more convenient when changing an actors position.

data.title: Using freetype with border and shadow makes font disappear
data.body:
A big issue:
With LibGDX 1.7.2 the freetype implementation has a bug.
If you use both, border and shadow, than the font disappears. No errors or messages or something, the font will simply will not be drawn and has no bounds.

A minor issue:
Don't know if that was true before but If you specify only one parameter for the shadow offset like only the x-offset and not the y-offset, the game crashes. I don't know if this comes with Libgdx 1.7.2 too or has been true before.

data.title: Fix another draw method.
data.body: Related to #3625. Noticed another broken overload.
